data.question: What is the primary focus of the research article?
data.answer: The primary focus of the research article is on fluoroarene separations in metalâ€“organic frameworks with two proximal Mg2+ coordination sites.

data.question: Which metal-organic frameworks (MOFs) were evaluated for their ability to separate fluoroarene isomers?
data.answer: MOFs such as Mg2(dobdc), Mg2(m-dobdc), Mg2(dobpdc), Co2(dobdc), Co2(m-dobdc), Ni2(dobdc), Ni2(m-dobdc), Zn2(dobdc), and Cu3(btc)2 were evaluated for their ability to separate fluoroarene isomers.

data.question: What method was used to determine the selectivity of MOFs for different fluoroarene isomers?
data.answer: Liquid-phase multicomponent equilibrium adsorption experiments and density functional theory (DFT) calculations were used to determine the selectivity of MOFs for different fluoroarene isomers.

data.question: Which MOF showed the highest selectivity for separating p-difluorobenzene from o-difluorobenzene and m-difluorobenzene?
data.answer: Mg2(dobdc) showed the highest selectivity for separating p-difluorobenzene from o-difluorobenzene and m-difluorobenzene.

data.question: How were the MOFs activated before use in adsorption experiments?
data.answer: The MOFs were activated under flowing N2 at elevated temperatures, followed by heating under high vacuum, before use in adsorption experiments.

data.question: What was the role of single-crystal X-ray diffraction in this study?
data.answer: Single-crystal X-ray diffraction was used to determine the crystal structures of MOFs and to analyze the binding modes of fluoroarene molecules within the MOFs.

data.question: True or False: Mg2(m-dobdc) was found to be ineffective in separating fluoroarene isomers.
What was the significance of using breakthrough experiments in this study?
data.answer: Breakthrough experiments were significant for evaluating the dynamic separation performance of MOFs under conditions that mimic real-world applications.

data.question: Which computational method was employed to study the interaction of fluoroarenes with MOFs?
data.answer: Density functional theory (DFT) calculations with van der Waals dispersion corrections were employed to study the interaction of fluoroarenes with MOFs.

data.question: True or False: The study demonstrated that MOFs can be recycled and reused for fluoroarene separation without significant loss in performance.
